column4: I just installed a new mobo and I can't seem to start x. I get the error messages "[drm] failed to open device" followed by "VESA(0): No valid modes" followed by "Screen(s) found, but none have a usable configuration". How can I debug this?
thanks. none of those solutions work though. also when it says "gdm is configured to help you configure your display when gdm fail to start", what is that supposed to mean?
well gdm is the login facility, i guess it means it is smart about helping you to get X configured if it doesnt work
are you logged in as root?
no, I don't think this computer is configured with a root login
you could look at the xorg.conf file and see what modes and drivers it tries to load
apparently my xorg.conf file is now empty. let me see if i have a backup
yeah, it's empty and i didn't make a backup. I thought that `sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg ` would create a new file from a template. apparently not in ubuntu 10.10
hah it would be nice if i could copy and paste, but the computer i'm talking about is beside me
might have to change "nvidia" if you dont have that driver loaded. (lsmod | grep nvidia)
